title: Performance Analysis of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) Variants
abstract:
There are various TCP variants such as Reno, Tahoe, Vegas, SACK and so on.
These variants implement algorithms that handle congestion control. In our
experiments we have used these variants to measure their performance such as
throughput, delay (latency), and drop rate with respect to time and Constant
Bit Rate (CBR) - no congestion control, specified bandwidth and sends packets
at a specified rate. We have used the NS2 network simulator to perform all our
experiments to analyze TCP performance.
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Networking and Internet Architecture
